Tucson had to think and move quickly which was not very easy for him due to=
 his injury.  Still, in the same vicinity as Scourge, Cyclonus and Rodimus,=
 he manages to keep himself out of sight, using the skills which had been t=
aught to him by Prowl. Quietly he stands up against a wall in a dark crevac=
e of the room, making no sound.  He thinks for just a moment at how cowardi=
ce this must seem.  To try and make a move and then recede into darkness li=
ke a spinless glitch.  That he was not.  He could feel the hold Cyclonus ha=
d over Rodimus and it enrages him to the point where he grips his fists in =
anger.  He thinks to himself.

" I've come this far, I just can't give up a=
nd turn the other way.  Rodimus, whether he knows it or not, needs my help.=
  But how to go about this?  This is something Kup nor Prowl trained me to =
do."

He puts his hand on his chest.  His actions were of his spark, not of=
 his mind.  His spark was telling him to continue on and not give up. 
He r=
emembers the good days when Rodimus was very close to all his Autobot comra=
des, and how many battles were won thanks to him and his guidence.  And now=
, it appeared that Rodimus was the one who needed to be rescued.  He closes=
 his eyes in thought.

" Optimus Prime, what would you have done if you wer=
e in my position? If there were a time when I needed your guidence, it's no=
w.  Rodimus needs me but how?  How can I pull this off?  I'm just one Autob=
ot with only his bare spark leading him..."  

In thought he tries to go ba=
ck to a time, when he had met Optimus Prime as a young rookie in training. =
 He flashes back to one particular moment when he actually got the opportun=
ity to talk to the great Autobot leader.  He remembers how he was told that=
 no matter how dim a situation was, there was always a light to guide them =
through.  It comes to him, the very verse Rodimus had said when he first to=
ok up the Matrix of Leadership.

"Light our Darkest Hour."  He thinks to hi=
mself at first.

"That's it.  That's what Optimus Prime would have done. Bu=
t instead of the Matrix it's up to ME to light our darkest hour.  Of course=
, I awoke first, it must mean something.  All right, Tucson get off your so=
rry aft and make this happen."

He gathers the strength to walk into where =
he could be seen, judging by the heat that lights were giving off, as faint=
 as the lights may be.  He stands before Cyclonus, and Scourge unarmed, yet=
 ready to defend himself if need be.

" Yes, you do have someone here.  And=
 that someone is me.  I don't know if you remember me or not, we may not ha=
ve even met.  My name is Tucson and I'm proud to say that I am a member of =
the Autobot faction."  

He then senses Rodimus not too far away.

" All ri=
ght, Rodimus, I have a question for you, and you may answer at will.  What =
was the very verse that brought the Matrix of Leadership to life, thus givi=
ng you the power of its spark?  I know you know this, and right now you may=
 be hating my sorry servos, but I think I could use a refresher on what it =
was.  Can you tell me?"

He was now preparing himself to get the bolts beat=
en out of him.  This would either make or break things.  It was a heck of a=
 gamble yet Tucson knew it was his greatest Trump Card and he was not afrai=
d to use it.  

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonu=
s@...> wrote:

> As Hydras' extended his invitation to Cyclonus, and Scour=
ge, Rodimus was surprised for a moment, but then just leaned back against a=
 support beam, his arms once again folded across his chest. He was about to=
 say some thing really clever about this when he thought he heard something=
 . . . 
> 
> >"Rodimus."
> 
> Dark Rodimus jerked up. He was not sure what =
he heard,=A0but it sounded like=A0some sort of ghostly whisper of his name.=
 He glanced around . . .=A0
>

on the alert, his hyper keen senses also keying in on the strange whisper. =
He whipped his disintergration rifle out and began to look around, his opti=
cs narrow and watchful. 
> 
> "What was what?" Cyclonus said, obviously una=
ware of the whisper, but he too grew more watchful, trusting Scourge's sens=
es. 
> 
> >"This is Perceptor, We may have a posible intruder..." The Sguri=
ty
> >=A0Drones are released to start a search party"
>

ourge almost hissed as he began to move around the room, his weapon was onc=
e again drawn and ready. 
> 
> Rodimus, his=A0quarrel with Cyclonus and Sco=
urge all but forgotten as this new situation developed had already drawn hi=
s weapon as well. There would be time enough for thier fight once this was =
over. 
> 
> "What is it?" Rodimus said, his voice tense but ready.
> 
> Sco=
urge grunted, "I had it. It smelled like an Autobot" Scourge continued to p=
rowl around the room, his optics glowing as he probed different areas.
> 
>=
 "Ahhhh . . ." Scourge squated down to run two fingers on=A0the ground and =
hold it to his nose, " . . . But he was here." Scourge chuckled darkly. "An=
d we shall find him, yes we shall, we have prey." 
> 
> > Hydras when he he=
ard his security chief warning said "Every one take 
> > a search PArty and=
 seek every inch of this base"
> 
> Cyclonus nodded as he watched, "Hydras,=
 I shall help coordinate the seaerh from here."
> 
> Dark Rodimus glanced b=
ack at Hydras and then at Scourge and Cyclonus, "And I'm going to catch tha=
t intruder!" His voice all business now. "Whatever it is we're going to=A0c=
atch it, and dismantle it . . ." Rodimus=A0energized his weapon, " . . . Th=
e HARD way!"
> 
> Scourge stood up saying nothing,=A0looking off in the dir=
ection that his powerful tracking sensors told him=A0were small droplets of=
 lubricant, and his quarry. With smooth and whisper silent strides he took =
off at a jog,=A0followed quickly and somewhat more=A0loudly=A0by=A0Rodimus!=
